attributes.comment:
As a family waiting to adopt from China, we are very distressed and disappointed
that the U.S. government is considering increasing the fees related to citizenship
for internationally adopted children. The adoption process is already a costly and
lengthy one, and due to the short period of time these approvals are good for (15
months for fingerprints and 18 months for the I600A), we have had to reapply and
spend double the initial cost already. Now with this increase, we will also have to
spend over $200 more to apply for the N600?! For families that already are doing
everything they can to pull the money together to adopt internationally, this is very
discouraging.

If you are seriously considering increasing the fees, please consider lengthening
the time these applications are valid before need to renew! Without a lengthening
of the approval periods, an increase in fees will only cost adoptive families more
money for an already very expensive endeavor.

We respectfully voice our opposition to USCIS-2006-0044 and this increase in
fees. Please reconsider this decision.

Sincerely,

Troy & Christine Mathison

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Troy & Christine Mathison
